elements.title: Grey's Monument (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1941 a bolt of lightning knocked off the head of Grey's Monument (pictured)?

elements.title: Djoko Munandar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after being removed from his post as governor due to a corruption case, Djoko Munandar was later found not guilty?

elements.title: Freedom & Civilization (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Freedom & Civilization, an anthropological analysis of the concept of freedom, Bronisław Malinowski argues for the creation of a world government?

elements.title: Sandra Dombrowski (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sandra Dombrowski was the first female to referee an IIHF World Women's Championship gold-medal game?

elements.title: Great World MRT station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a construction worker working on the Great World MRT station died after an excavator's bucket dislodged and fell on him?

elements.title: Edith Rosenwald Stern (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sears heiress Edith Rosenwald Stern organized a women's broom brigade against political corruption in New Orleans?

elements.title: Leedy Manufacturing Company (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Leedy Manufacturing Company of Indianapolis, Indiana, was at one point the largest manufacturer of drums in the world?

elements.title: Miao Xiyong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ming-dynasty physician Miao Xiyong used a virgin boy's urine to treat a stroke patient?
